body_html: @csarofeen It's when you want to set the initial hidden state to fixed values (like all zeros). One can create a new all-zero variable in the "forward" function but will have to deal with whether to send it to GPU manually. Another option is to make it a parameter of the module and set "requires_grad" to False. In this case, the batch size is not known when defining the model and should be able to change during runtime, so it'll be very convenient if GRUCell and LSTMCell support hidden state broadcasting.
